Package edu.cornell.gdiac.audio

Interface MusicQueue

All Superinterfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music
public interface MusicQueue extends com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music
This interface represents a continuous audio stream. As a subinterface of Music, this supports pausing, resuming and so on. In addition, it supports a simple music queue that allows you to programmatically string audio assets together for gapless playback. When the buffer has only one source, it behaves the same as a Music object. However, when there is more than one source, both the methods Music.setLooping(boolean) and Music.setPosition(float) behave differently. Setting the position sets the accumulated position across all sources. Looping may either be local (it loops the current source, preventing queue advancement) or global (the queue loops when it reaches the end of all sources) according the value setLoopBehavior(boolean). Music buffer instances are created via AudioEngine.newMusic(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle). When you are done with using the music buffer instance you have to dispose it via the Music.dispose() method. This interface is not even remotely thread-safe. LibGDX requires that all audio interfaces be interacted with in the main application thread (for much the same reason that OpenGL requires this).

  • Method Details

    • setOnTransitionListener

      void setOnTransitionListener(MusicQueue.OnTransitionListener listener)
      Registers a callback invoked as the music queue is processed.
      Parameters:
      listener - The callback that will be run.

    • isMono

      boolean isMono()
      Returns true if this is a mono music stream. LibGDX only supports mono and stereo audio streams. It does not support complex multi-channel streams (such as 7.1 surround).
      Returns:
      true if this is a mono music stream.

    • getSampleRate

      int getSampleRate()
      Returns the number of audio samples (per channel) per second. All sources added to a music buffer must have the same sample rate (unless you do not care about your pitch, that is.
      Returns:
      the number of audio samples (per channel) per second.

    • getDuration

      float getDuration()
      Returns the current duration of this music stream in seconds. The duration is the sum of the durations of all of the sources in the music buffer.

    • setPitch

      void setPitch(float pitch)
      Sets the pitch of the music stream The pitch multiplier is value between 0.5 and 2.0, where 1 is unchanged, >1 is faster, and invalid input: '<'1 is slower.
      Parameters:
      pitch - The pitch of the music stream

    • getPitch

      float getPitch()
      Returns the pitch of the music stream The pitch multiplier is value between 0.5 and 2.0, where 1 is unchanged, >1 is faster, and invalid input: '<'1 is slower.
      Returns:
      the pitch of the music stream

    • setPan

      void setPan(float pan)
      Sets the pan of the given music stream The pan is a value -1 to 1. The value 0 is the default center position. -1 is full left and 1 is full right.
      Parameters:
      pan - The pan value -1 (left) to 1 (right). Use 0 for center.

    • getPan

      float getPan()
      Returns the pan value of the music stream The pan is a value -1 to 1. The value 0 is the default center position. -1 is full left and 1 is full right.
      Returns:
      the pan value of the music stream

    • setLoopBehavior

      void setLoopBehavior(boolean local)
      Sets the loop behavior of this music buffer. Loop behavior may be local or global. If the stream has only one source, they are the same. Local looping loops in place at the current source, preventing advancement in the queue. Global looping loops the entire stream when it reaches the end. If loop behavior is local, any method that causes the stream to leave the current source (such as advanceSource()) will clear the looping setting.
      Parameters:
      local - Whether the loop behavior is local

    • getLoopBehavior

      boolean getLoopBehavior()
      Returns the loop behavior of this music buffer. Loop behavior may be local or global. If the stream has only one source, they are the same. Local looping loops in place at the current source, preventing advancement in the queue. Global looping loops the entire stream when it reaches the end. If loop behavior is local, any method that causes the stream to leave the current source (such as advanceSource()) will clear the looping setting.
      Returns:
      the loop behavior of this music buffer.

    • addEffect

      void addEffect(EffectFilter effect)
      Add an effect to the music playback
      Parameters:
      effect - The effect Object

    • removeEffect

      void removeEffect(EffectFilter effect)
      Remove an effect from the sound instance
      Parameters:
      effect - The effect Object

    • clearAllEffect

      void clearAllEffect()
      Clear all effects on the music playback

    • getNumberOfSources

      int getNumberOfSources()
      Returns the number of audio sources in this buffer
      Returns:
      the number of audio sources in this buffer

    • getCurrent

      AudioSource getCurrent()
      Returns the current audio sources being played. The buffer does not have to be playing to return a value. If it does return a source, this is the source that will first be played when playback resumes.
      Returns:
      the current audio sources being played.

    • getSource

      AudioSource getSource(int pos)
      Returns the audio source at the given queue position. If the position is invalid, this method returns null.
      Returns:
      the audio source at the given queue position.

    • setSource

      void setSource(int pos, AudioSource source)
      Sets the source for the given position. It is safe to call this method while the buffer is playing. If this method replaces the source currently being played, it will start to play the new source from the beginning.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position in the source queue
      source - The source to place

    • addSource

      void addSource(AudioSource source)
      Adds the given source as the source queue. It is safe to call this method while the buffer is playing, though gapless playback is only guaranteed if it is added with enough lead time.
      Parameters:
      source - The source to add

    • insertSource

      void insertSource(int pos, AudioSource source)
      Insert the source at the given position. It is safe to call this method while the buffer is playing, though it may be skipped over if the current source position is previous the one being inserted.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position in the source queue
      source - The source to insert

    • removeSource

      AudioSource removeSource(int pos)
      Removes the source at the given position. It is safe to call this method while the buffer is playing. If this source is the current one playing, the buffer will skip to the next source in the queue. In addition, if there is a transition listener it will update that transition as well. This method will return null if the position is invalid
      Parameters:
      pos - The position in the source queue
      Returns:
      the source removed from the given position

    • clearSources

      void clearSources()
      Clears the music buffer, removing all sources. It is safe to call them method while the buffer is playing. It will immediately halt all playback.

    • advanceSource

      void advanceSource()
      Advances the music buffer to the next audio source in the queue The position will be set to the start of the next audio source. If there is no audio source, it will stop playback. If there is an attached transition listener, it will be notified of the transition.

    • advanceSource

      void advanceSource(int steps)
      Advances the music buffer the given number of steps in the queue The position will be set to the start the given number of steps away in the queue. Calling this with steps==0 will be the same as reseting the current audio source. This method may not be used to go backwards in the queue. If there is no audio source at the given position, it will stop playback. If there is an attached transition listener, it will be notified of the transition.
      Parameters:
      steps - The number of steps to advance forward.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if steps invalid input: '<' 0

    • jumpToSource

      void jumpToSource(int pos)
      Jumps to the given source in the music buffer queue If there is no audio source at the given position, it will stop playback. If there is an attached transition listener, it will be notified of the transition.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position in the source queue

    • reset

      void reset()
      Resets the music buffer to very beginning of the stream. The stream will return to the very beginning of the first source in the buffer queue.
